name: pyagrum-nightly
description: Bayesian networks and other Probabilistic Graphical Models.
unavailable_reason: Repository is on gitlab. Using deps.dev for cross-forge analysis.

readme.summary: Well-structured README with excellent clarity and installation instructions, but lacks inline code examples, configuration guidance, and troubleshooting support.
readme.top_issue: No actual code examples showing basic usage - only links to external resources, preventing users from seeing quick examples of creating or using Bayesian networks directly in the README

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite 'nightly' package designation
No active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs or releases in past 6 months
Zero issue activity (no opens, closes, or discussions)
Last commit over 1 month ago with no follow-up activity
positive_signals: No open issues indicating unresolved problems
maintenance.summary: Package is abandoned with no maintenance activity or releases for 6+ months, incompatible with expected nightly release cadence.

project_metrics.description: aGrUM is a C++ library designed for easily building applications using graphical models such as Bayesian networks, influence diagrams, decision trees, GAI networks or Markov decision processes.
